intro: Turraea fischeri subsp. fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's turraea, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
